algorithm_technique: Number generation based on palindromic structure in a given base, then checking base-10 palindrome
Number generation based on palindromic structure in base-k, then checking base-10 palindrome
problem_summary_simple: Find the sum of the n smallest numbers that are palindromic in both base-10 and base-k.
problem_summary_technical: Generates palindromic numbers in base-k and checks if they are also palindromic in base-10, summing the first n.
key_insights: The core idea is to generate palindromes efficiently in base-k and then verify them in base-10.
The `mirror` function constructs palindromes by mirroring a prefix, handling odd/even lengths.
This solution generates palindromes by manipulating digits in base-k directly, building them from the center outwards.
It converts the base-k palindrome to base-10 and checks for base-10 palindromic property.
